Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: A solid, well-designed set of noise-cancelling headphones offering good noise-dampening and respectable sound quality at a reasonably affordable price. If Audio-Technica could improve on overall clarity with the next version, it could have a winner on its hands. I'll be straight with you: much as I like some in-ear headphones, given the choice between listening to a set of IEMs and a pair of proper, full-sized cans, I'd choose the latter every time. However, there are times when that choice isn't really a choice at all. When you're travelling, for example, it's just a non-starter. Sure, you could take your open-back Grado SR-80s or your Sennheiser HD595s on the train, but sound leaks out like crazy and – worse – sound leaks in. This means you turn the headphones up even louder, and you're ... generously sharing your taste in music with every poor soul in the vicinity. Closed-back headphones often do a better job of keeping the sound inside the headphones and attenuating outside noise, but the ones I like best – like BeyerDynamic's DT770s – tend to be too large for use on the move. In the end, a set of IEMs is the solid, practical choice. /beab28|2fca_12843-athanc7b.jpg There is a third option, however: active noise-cancelling headphones like the Audio-Technica ATH-ANC7b we're looking at today. Rather than relying on the physical construction of the headphones to shield the ear from noise, they use a built-in microphone or microphones to sample the external racket, then an integrated processor creates an equal but opposite noise which, added to the signal, cancels it out. It's an approach that has been used with considerably success by Sennheiser with its NoiseGard line and Bose with its QuietComfort series. AudioTechnica's QuietPoint range hasn't been quite so prominent over here, but that's a situation the Japanese audio specialist hopes will change with this new and improved model, which won an Innovations award at this year's CES. /ca2816|c5c9_12843-athanc7b1.jpg As they're designed primarily for travel use, noise-cancelling headphones need to be compact, and the ATH-ANC7b setup is about as compact as a pair of circumaural (over the ear) cans can get. With the cups twisted downwards they fit into a square-ish rigid carrying case measuring approximately 20 x 21cm and 5.5cm deep. This takes up a spare bit of room in your backpack or hand-luggage, but at just under 500g the weight isn't extravagant, and there's enough spare room to cram in your PMP or MP3 player too, provided it's around the same size as or smaller than an iPod touch. Supplied accessories include a 6.3mm plug adaptor, airline adaptor and Velcro-ed in accessory pouch plus – as the cable is plugged rather than hard-wired in – a choice of two cables, measuring either 1m or 1.6m. Sometimes you need that extra length when using headphones with a Hi-Fi, TV or PC, but you don't want to have to drag all that cable around when you're listening to your PMP on the bus. This setup makes a lot of sense. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Lightweight; Compact
Cons: Uncomfortable
I like these headphones. I'm not an audiophile. To my ears they sound pretty good; not fabulous but good. They're a lot cheaper than other noise cancelling headphones in their class. I don't actually use the noise cancelling feature that often. It does seem to help somewhat. I like their size and weight. Very compact and easy to carry. The only real fault I can find with them is that they are a little uncomfortable for me. The fit is just a tad tighter than I'd like no matter how I adjust them, but it's not a big deal unless I wear them for hours on end.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Good Value; Good Bass; Comfortable
I use these when traveling. So far, they are excellent, offering comparable, in my opinion, noise reduction to Bose products, but at a far lower price. I also have been impressed by battery efficiency. I can get two 5-hour flights out of a single AAA battery. This would be unheard of with the Bose. Two small criticisms: the bass seems overdriven, but this is a subjective assessment, and, the cord seems rather think, and has an odd right-angle plug, which may make it difficult to replace. Otherwise, I am very, very happy with these.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Durable; Good Value; Compact; Lightweight; Good Bass; Great Sound; Stylish
Excellent headphones!! Not too expensive for the great quality of sound and noise reduction you get compared to Bose and the likes. The noise cancellation feature can be improved. Other than that, it is a great buy.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Good audio; Good Value; Great Sound
Cons: None
This is the 2nd pair I have purchased to replace the previous one which was broken by my lawnmower. I had to use a riding lawnmower to cut grasses in my yard. The lawnmower is noisy.I used the headphone mainly to reduce the noise level to acceptable level while listening to radio or music of my choice. I also use it in long flights to listen to movies.
I have been using this Audio Technics noise cancellation headphone for over ten years and still very satisfy with its performance. The headphone is very comfortable to ware for hours. The noise cancellation is very good. The sound quality is also excellent. In a noisy airplane enviroment, it creates the quiet backgroud for your ears to hear the crisp soun ... d from you movie or music that you are watching or listening to. The battery also lasts very very long.
The construction is very rugged. I appreciate the shorter cable provided by the new one. The case provides good protection to the headphone and can withstand a lot of abuses. I have travelled many years and many times with the headphone as hand carry with no problem.
I don't see any problem after more than 10 years of using it. I am still very satisfy with it. That is why I bought the same one when the original one got destroyed by my lawnmower when my head was brushed by a tree branch and it fell under my lawnmower. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Good Value; Comfortable
Cons: Unattractive Design
I did a lot of research comparing these mostly to the Bose QC. The noise canceling is great and the sound is amazing. Other reviews say that the Bose noise canceling and bass is better; I believe it. I also consider the Bose to be considerably more stylish. HavIng said that, I love these headphones, and they are definitely worth the price (half as expensive as Bose). They sound great, I was not disappointed.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: No More repeats on the train
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Lightweight; Good Bass; Compact; Stylish; Durable; Comfortable; Great Sound
So far so good. Though I could still hear noises in the subway, but it kills enough ambient noises and especially noises that are near my ears, so I could still hear every word clearly even though there are loud blastings outside.
The only thing that I am hoping not to have is when I turn up the volume, people on the outside could hear what I'm listening to rather clearly, especially when things outside got quiet. Nonetheless, the quality with such price is so well balanced that if they are going to be messed by solving my small problem, I'd rather say it's good enough.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Bass; Stylish; Great Sound; Comfortable; Good Value
Outstanding sound quality. I beleive as good a Bose and much better price compared to product quality. Happy that I pruchsed these headphones.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Comfortable; Great Sound; Good Bass; Good Value
Cons: Cord Too Short
This is great value compared to bose. 1/3 the price. 95% of the noisec reduction. with better construction

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Bass; Compact; Lightweight; Great Sound; Good Value
Used it for a flight from Vancouver, Canada to London and it helped immensely. Noise reduction on the flight was very effective. You can't mask the plane's low rumble as that is transmitted right through your body but it subjectively feels about 75%-85% quieter, and it becomes quiet hum like an fan. You can still make out speech from the announcements but the volume is much lower. Surprisingly they do take most of the edge out of the sound of crying babies as I had a few screaming infants on all flights about 10 rows ahead and behind me. Overall comfort was decent but I wear glasses, and over the course of the flight (I had it on most of the 10 hours), there was a tiny bit of soreness from the cups pushing against my eye ... wear temples. If you don't have eyewear, this is not likely to be an issue at all. Sound quality was great for closed headphones. Not quite up to the quality of my Sennheisers HD555's but good enough for travelling. These wouldn't be my first choice for home audio. For the price, quality of sound and overall excellent noise reduction, it's a great value. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Great Sound; Good Value
Cons: Uncomfortable
Sound quality and noise cancellation is very good. Battery life has also been very good. This is my third pair of noise cancellation headphones in 4 years and they have been very durable. Comfort is an issue for me when using them on flights that last 3-4 hours. The QC15 comfort is much better but you pay significantly more for them.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Really close to Bose...I've had both!
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Great Sound; Good Bass
Cons: None
After about 5 hrs they get to be little uncomfortable on the ears. Really close to Bose and in some ways better.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Durable; Stylish; Comfortable; Great Sound
Liked my first pair so much that I bought this pair for my college aged daughter. Very good noise cancelling. Great style and comfort. Good sound quality, especially with cancelling mode on. Solid protective travel case. This is a great value product.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Comfortable; Good Bass; Great Sound; Lightweight
Great product. Performs every bit as well as the Bose, but at significantly lower price. I love that we didn't have to pay for the name!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good product for the value.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Good Value; Lightweight; Comfortable
Cons: Unattractive Design
Read a lot of reviews before buying these headphones. The sound quality is very good. I'm not a sound expert, so I can't comment on the pro/cons of things like bass, treble, etc. But, I can tell you that the overall sound of these headphone is very good. Not so good when the noise cancellation is turned off, but at least you can continue to listen to music if the battery dies. The only bad think I'd have to say about these headphones is that they look a little big on my head. It would be good if they could make the design a little smaller.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent balance of quality and cost
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Durable; Good Value; Good Bass; Comfortable; Lightweight; Compact
I bought this to use on airplanes. Perfect and at a very reasonable price. About $200 less than it's formidable competitor, Bose.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Stylish; Lightweight; Good Value; Great Sound
Cons: Volume could be louder
I use this during flights to watch movies and listen to music. The volume could be louder but the sound is excellent quality and the price is reasonable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Good Bass; Good Value; Comfortable; Great Sound
I use these to reduce the ambient sound of the street that we chose to live on. I play delta wave music to put me to sleep at night, and these phones are very comfortable for that, and the sound is clear and detailed. I have looked at the qc15 and the pxc 450, but for the money and the use, these headphones are by far the best value. I am getting 2 more pair for my family members.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Good Value; Good Bass
Cons: Small for a large head
For just over $100, perfect.
My only issue, and it is a small one at that, is that I have a large head (7'3/4" hat size) and the headphones are 'snug'; not a problem, just something of which to be aware.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Comfortable
I was told noise canceling headphones were a must for long international flights. I had an 11 hour flight from San Francisco to London as my first experience with these headphones and it was great! It was fun switching the noise canceling on and off and hearing the difference.
I have a pair of in-ear monitors that are really great, but they get a little uncomfortable for long periods, which is why I was looking for some over the ear models.
As much as I'm sure the Bose models would be fantastic, I really like that these use a standard battery (AAA) and cable. No need to recharge batteries or worry too much about having to replace the cable if needed.
For the price, I don't know if you could beat the quality of these headph ... ones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Comfortable; Great Sound; Good Bass
Read a lot of positive reviews on these and decided to give them a try for a long upcoming trip. Initial impression is very favorable and the price definitely was a selling point.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Durable; Great Sound; Good Value
Cons: Maybe a bit big for some
A great traveling pair of headphones. Get there rested & relaxed, with or without music & movies. Really shuts out the noise, as my Wife says it sounds like you stepped into a sound proof booth. Good sound with comfort & excellent noise reduction. Not the smallest or lightest, but super comfortable & to me very good value !

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Just as good as the Bose
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Great Sound; Good Bass; Good Value
I have tried the Bose and the only difference I can tell is in the price. I only use them when I need to work or relax in noisy places like a coffee shop, airplane/airport, home (when the kids are being loud). They are very comfortable but my ears will get a bit warm sometimes.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value
This headphone set was recently purchased primarily for long trip air travel. The headphones performed very well as so far as a noise cancelling device, and the product seems like it will be durable. The sound quality is quite good with noise cancelling mode turned on. Sound leakage was of no concern on the airplane. With prolonged use, you go get a little warm under the ears but this is a minor complaint. The device is not uncomfortable. Overall, this seems to be an excellent purchase for the money spent. Long flights are definitely more enjoyable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Mre bang for the buck than Bose.
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Great noise cancelling; Removavle Cord
Looks a little odd, but it cuts down on jet engine noise significantly. I have tried the Bose QC 15 on a trans-Atlantic flight and the noise cancelling is at least as good as the Bose for 1/3 the price. Case is sturdy, but a little bulky. If your head is on the large side, this may not fit too well.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Bass; Durable; Great Sound; Lightweight; Good Value; Compact
Cons: Uncomfortable
This is the first pair of noise canceling headphones I got. I was debating between this and the Bose qc15. After reading a few reviews I settled for this because they were $200 less and won a bunch of awards. I do not regret my decision. They are good for on the go. You can enjoy your music without all that noise. The best part is you don't have kill your eardrums with high volumes. Just turn the noise canceling on and you are shaking your head to Coltrane. A little uncomfortable after an hour or so, but it's with it. Great product.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact; Great Sound; Comfortable; Good Value
Amazing product. I got one for myself, and purchased a second as a gift a few weeks later. Noise-cancelling isn't perfect, but it is more than sufficient to provide an enjoyable listening experience in noisy environments (cars, coffee shops, etc.). I recommend this product!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Comfortable; Great Sound
Recently used this headset on an 8 hour flight and it performed just as I needed it. Blocked out the airplane noise and the passenger noise. Felt very comfy.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Good sound; Fair noise canceling; Quality construction
Cons: Terrible sound leakage; Too Much Ambient Noise
These headphones are well made and have decent sound quality. However, they have terrible sound leakage (i.e., people around you will be able to hear what you're listenting to) and don't reduce ambient noise sufficiently (compared to the Bose QuietComfort 15). I primarily used them on a noisy commuter train. Overall, they're a good set of headphones for the price, but the deal breaker for me was the sound leakage. I had someone try them at a normal volume and I could hear everything as if I was listening to a transistor radio. Hope this helps.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Good Bass; Great Sound; Good Value
My husband bought these headphones for me for when I mow the grass and want to listen to my iPod. They cut out most of the mower's noise...much better than the $300 ones I bought for him a few years ago. I just bought him a new set of the updated model ANC7B..it now comes with two cords...short and long. An improvement over my older model that has a too long cord. Fabulous value and BuyDig has the best price on this!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Highly recommend for quality and price
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Good Bass; Compact; Lightweight; Durable; Great Sound; Comfortable
After conducting reviews for the ultimate noise-cancelling headphones I narrowed it down to the Bose and Audio-Technica. Originally planned to buy Bose since I have a Bose stereo in my office, a Home theatre surround sound Bose system as well as Bose In-ear Headphones. A friend had bought Audio Technica headphones for his wife and claimed the listening quality and comfort was equal to his Bose noise cancelling headphones. As a user of Audio Technica on a professional level (cordless microphone) I was very confident of it's durability and clean delivery for it was the best microphone I ever purchased and after 15 years it is still going strong. I purchased the Audio Technica and remain impressed. ... I use them on every opportunity that permits itself - expecially with the noise cancelling feature turned on. The music delivery was more clear and crisp via the noise cancelling feature activated than without it. The bass was more pronounced as well when activated than when not. Ambient noise is completely blocked out-even at the gym where the music seems to be at a constant high volume level. I look forward to testing the noise cancelling feature in my first airline trip with them. But at this point in my ownership I can highly recommend them. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: THese phones are fantastic. The do bleed a lot of sound to the outside world when listening, this was disappointing. The noise cancelling is pretty amazing to the listener. As fas as sound quality goes; these headphones sound great. VERY neutral. I ve compared them to me AKG Q701 s and they simply don t come close to the transperancey of the sound but for what these are they are superb.... THe nice case was the cherry on top. It can fit my sansa player and altoid cmoy headphone amp perfectly.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Good Value
works well. my wife has the bose noise cancelling headphones, which also work well, but at almost 3x the cost. would definitely buy again or as a gift.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Noise Cancellation; Great Sound
Cons: Unattractive Design
When noise cancelling is in off mode, sound quality is poor, but this is the case for most headphones with noise cancelling feature. I've been using an on-ear headphone, so it takes a bit getting use to an over the ear model. The unattractive design refers to the fact that the head band sticks out well beyond the contours of your head. Overall, a great value and would highly recommend.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Audio Technica ATH-ANC7b QuietPoint Active Noise-cancelling Review
Item.Review:
Pros: I've owned these headphones for 12 hours - noise reduction performance in office, train and home is impressive. Music reproduction is very good when active, adequate when turned off -although at a higher input power. Packaging is good with a zipped internal pocket for the accessories and a plastic form to keep the headphones straight. My reference is a set of Stax headphones.
Cons: The internal plastic form in the case is very thin and I expect it to disintegrate within 12 months. Packaging has no recycled content noted
I bought these online from ozheadphones and I'm very satisfied with my purchase. These are NOT audiophile headphones - they are good headphones with good noise reduction capability. I'm told there...

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Like AMEX...Don't leave home without it!
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Good Value; Great Sound; Comfortable
I needed a pair of NC headphones for the long flights for work. I did a lot of research and tested a whole bunch of NC headphones. The BOSE QC15 is no doubt one of the best on the market, but at 300-350, it's not in the price range for most people since they never go on sale. The Audio Technica NC7b works just as well in my opinion and with the HUGE price gap, it was a no brainer to get this one. I've used them on flights, it blocks out a lot of noise. With some content on, you won't heard much of the engine and crying babies etc. Sound quality is great! I mean you won't get the same kind of sound coming out of NC headphones compared to Open air headhphones or some high end non-NC headphones. But as far as NC headphones are concern ... ed, I think these sound better than the bose. (Bose may sound better when you test them, but that's because their stations automatically turn up the volumne so you think it blocks out all the noise). Both claim that they block out 90% of noise, and imo, both are great. But for 1/3 of the price, you'd be insane not to get these!
BuyDig is an authorized dealer so buy with confidence!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Good Value
Cons: Bass is not so deep
Amazing noise cancellation headset. The sound quality is good but not great. I would still recommend them.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Great Sound; Lightweight; Good Value; Compact; Comfortable; Good Bass
First listened to these from a friend and was very surprised. Have used them primarily on computer and ipod and have absolutely no complaints. I'm a big music listener and these may be the best headphones I've ever owned. My kids love them so much they want a pair.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Bass; Comfortable; Great Sound; Lightweight; Good Value
These headphones worked a treat. For the price they are an excellent choice and I recommend this product.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH ANC7b QuietPoint - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Stylish; Good Value; Comfortable; Durable
Used on International flight, it was quite comforting. My friend compaired side by side with his Sony headphones and he said mine are better (Which is very difficult for his nature to accept but surprisingly he did)
It eliminates that airplane sound but not everything....you can still hear some engine noice if music is not on. If music is on you won't notice much. Carry bag is very good and compact.
